text.div:
<!-- Resources -->
<!-- StructuredDataCaptureAnswers -->
<QuestionnaireAnswers xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir">
 <!-- from Element: extension -->
 <extension><!-- 0..* Extension Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
 <modifierExtension><!-- 0..* Extension Extensions that cannot be ignored --></modifierExtension>
 <text><!-- 0..1 Narrative Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation --></text>
 <contained><!-- 0..* Resource Contained, inline Resources --></contained>
 <questionnaire><!-- 1..1 Resource(Questionnaire) Form being answered --></questionnaire>
 <status value="[code]"/><!-- 1..1 in progress | completed | amended -->
 <subject><!-- 1..1 Resource(Patient) The subject of the questions --></subject>
 <author><!-- 0..1 Resource(Practitioner|Patient|RelatedPerson) 
     Person who received and recorded the answers --></author>
 <authored value="[dateTime]"/><!-- 1..1 Date this version was authored -->
 <source><!-- 0..1 Resource(Patient|Practitioner|RelatedPerson) 
     The person who answered the questions --></source>
 <encounter><!-- 0..1 Resource(Encounter) 
     Primary encounter during which the answers were collected --></encounter>
 <group> 1..1 =Group  <!-- 1..1 Grouped questions -->
  <extension><!-- 0..* Extension Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
  <modifierExtension><!-- 0..* Extension Extensions that cannot be ignored --></modifierExtension>
  <linkId><!-- Corresponding group within Questionnaire --></linkId>
  <title value="[string]"/><!-- 0..1 Name for this group -->
  <text value="[string]"/><!-- 0..1 Additional text for the group -->
  <subject><!-- 0..1 Resource(Any) The subject this group's answers are about --></subject>
  <group><!-- 0..* Content as for QuestionnaireAnswers.group Grouped questions --></group>
  <question> 0..* =Question  <!-- 0..* Questions in this group -->
   <extension><!-- 0..* Extension Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
   <modifierExtension><!-- 0..* Extension Extensions that cannot be ignored --></modifierExtension>
   <linkId value="[string]"/><!-- 1..1 Corresponding question within Questionnaire -->
   <text value="[string]"/><!-- 1..1 Text of the question as it is shown to the user -->
   <answer>  <!-- 0..0 The response(s) to the question -->
   </answer>
   <group><!-- 0..* Content as for QuestionnaireAnswers.group Grouped questions --></group>
  </question>
 </group>
</QuestionnaireAnswers>

name: Structured Data Capture Data Capture
publisher: U.S. Office of the National Coordinator (ONC)
description: Defines how the questionnaire answers resource is used to reflect form data within the ONC's Structured Data Capture standard.

definition.short: A structured set of questions and their answers
definition.formal: A structured set of questions and their answers.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. definition.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
definition.formal: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
definition.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

definition.formal: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
definition.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

definition.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
definition.formal: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
definition.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

definition.formal: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
definition.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

definition.formal: Form being answered.
in progress | completed | amended.

binding.name: QuestionnaireAnswersStatus
binding.description: Lifecycle status of the questionnaire answers

definition.formal: The subject of the questions.

definition.short: Person who received and recorded the answers
definition.formal: Person who received and recorded the answers.
definition.comments: Mapping a subject's answers to multiple choice options and determining what to put in the textual answer is a matter of interpretation.

definition.formal: Identifies when this version of the answer set was created.  Changes whenever the answers are updated.
definition.comments: May be different from the update time of the resource itself, because that is the status of the collection and authoring.

definition.short: The person who answered the questions
definition.formal: The person who answered the questions.

definition.short: Primary encounter during which the answers were collected
definition.formal: Primary encounter during which the answers were collected.
Grouped questions.
definition.comments: The Questionnaire itself has one "root" group with the actual contents of the Questionnaire.
